newsitem.title: ZIMBABWE: Zimbabwe vehicle population rising at five percent.
newsitem.headline: Zimbabwe vehicle population rising at five percent.

text.p: Zimbabwe's vehicle population is growing at about five percent a year and was around 850,000 by the end of 1996, the government said in the first official statistics on vehicles to be published in years.

The state Central Vehicle Registration figures show that government departments, the army, the police, and the diplomatic community had 140,000 vehicles on their books, with the general public holding the remaining 715,350 by last December 31.

Acting vehicle registrar Allowance Sango said the national vehicle population was increasing at about five percent annually, and that statistics were now easier to handle after the recent installation of a computerised system.
Vehicle records were largely in shambles under the old manual system, according to industry officials who want the government to add vehicles to a list of economic data it publishes regularly.
